title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 02 July 2012 - XWiki
content:
12:05 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
12:33 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
12:34 <sdumitriu> has quit  
13:15 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:41 <vmassol> tmortagne, mflorea: in platform I have put all functional-test-related modules in a submodule named test and only triggered if the profile was integration-tests  
13:41 <vmassol> I see you've put the po at the top level of modules without the profile  
13:41 <vmassol> btw I'm currently fixing all the deps you've broken  
13:42 <+mflorea> vmassol: what is the problem  
13:43 <+mflorea> we put it at 'top' level because there is no module with tests yet, i.e. the tests are still in enterprise  
13:43 <vmassol> mflorea: I raised the issue last week already, it's because you've renamed arttifacts  
13:43 <vmassol> but you haven't updated the poms using them  
13:43 <vmassol> that's what I'm doing now  
13:43 <+mflorea> which poms?  
13:43 <vmassol> I have fixed already 2 last week and doing the rest now  
13:43 <vmassol> everywhere they're used  
13:43 <vmassol> functional tests, XE xar  
13:43 <+mflorea> ok, will see your commit :)  
13:44 <vmassol> but  
13:44 <vmassol> my point above  
13:44 <vmassol> was to ask whether we shouldn't put them in a profile as we have for the rest  
13:44 <vmassol> because otherwise we have a discrepancy  
13:44 <+mflorea> I think tmortagne added the dependencies to exnteprise-test-pageobject, which should be used the these modules, so I still don't understand the problem  
13:44 <vmassol> we need something consistent  
13:46 <vmassol> mflorea: here's jsut one example: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/deddc2414631f2550ab6b706d9d47588ed7a7c02  
13:46 <vmassol> I've fixed about 8 or 9 now (not committed yet)  
13:46 <+mflorea> ah.. right  
13:47 <+mflorea> I'm fine with using  the integration-tests profile  
13:47 <vmassol> IMO it's the best because it'll reduce build time when you're not running IT  
13:47 <+mflorea> I suppose CI actives this profile when building platform  
13:47 <vmassol> yes  
13:47 <+mflorea> ok  
13:48 <+mflorea> good then  
13:49 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
13:51 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
13:54 <vmassol> note that I cannot push right now since I'm running TPC coverage and I don't want to git pull since that could skew my results  
13:55 <vmassol> but I have the fix committed locally  
13:55 <+mflorea> ok  
13:55 <vmassol> once I'm done with TPC for enterprise, I'll commit everything  
13:56 <vmassol> btw diff module in commons is missing some unit tests… ;) you'll see it on the clover reports when I publish them  
13:56 <+mflorea> :)  
13:57 <+mflorea> the diff api module or the diff display? There should be some unit tests for the diff display  
13:57 <sdumitriu> has quit  
13:57 <vmassol> I don't remember which one  
13:58 <vmassol> let me start to publish some reports  
13:58 <+mflorea> I'll check the reports  
13:58 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
13:58 <vmassol> I have commons, rendeirng, platform alone, then commons+rendering and commons+rendering+platform  
13:58 <vmassol> now doing enterprise alone and then commons+rendering+platform+enterprise  
14:07 <CIA-114> tmortagne master \* rf7bb578 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/f7bb578c1a68f3fdbc86f912ee866c58c7365f1b / xwiki-enterprise-ui/pom.xml : XWIKI-7979: Move platform applications test pages objects to platform - http://git.io/mkXniA  
14:12 <CIA-114> tmortagne master \* r7b3e8de https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/7b3e8dec905b49e736998bc52912056ed5051d64 / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7979: Move platform applications test pages objects to platform - http://git.io/agPENw  
14:14 <pgmjsd> has quit  
14:17 <pgmjsd> has joined #xwiki  
14:19 <vmassol> grrr, tmortagne beat me :)  
14:19 <+tmortagne> vmassol: taking care of profiles now  
14:19 <vmassol> I'll have to find my commits and revert them  
14:19 <vmassol> :(  
14:19 <vmassol> they're mixed in between lots of other commits  
14:20 <vmassol> tmortagne: that's why I took care of mentioning I had it done locally just above  
14:20 <vmassol> (to prevent someone from doing it)  
14:20 <+tmortagne> vmassol: you don't have to revert anything  
14:20 <vmassol> anyway I'll handle it  
14:20 <+tmortagne> git will take care of that  
14:20 <+tmortagne> when you will pull  
14:20 <vmassol> you can commit something that does nohitng.  
14:20 <vmassol> it'll remove the commit?  
14:20 <vmassol> without causing a conflict?  
14:21 <+tmortagne> from my expenrience of the same use cases yes it will simply remove the commit (if there is only that in your commit)  
14:21 <vmassol> ok cool  
14:21 <vmassol> we'll see  
14:21 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
14:21 <sdumitriu> has quit  
14:22 <sdumitriu1> is now known as <sdumitriu>  
14:27 <CIA-114> tmortagne master \* rb102b4d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/b102b4d829cab46496d09605b76b61a3bddb2a14 / (11 files in 11 dirs): XWIKI-7979: Move platform applications test pages objects to platform - http://git.io/RB9SMQ  
14:34 <CIA-114> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* re92b1a6 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/e92b1a6f0f184c729d7811f1a8e05e16f7d0b7e7 / xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/ui/extension/ExtensionTest.java : XE-1204: Add functional tests for Extension Manager - http://git.io/2wBgqw  
14:43 <vmassol> running ui functional tests now… I fear I'll have to redo it again with -Dmaven.test.failure.ignore=true since some tests are always failing on my mac…. this means the TPC won't be fully correct  
14:44 <vmassol> unless those tests have been fixed and are working now… that would be awesome...  
15:12 <vmassol> Tests run: 178, Failures: 4, Errors: 3, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 2,309.74 sec <<< FAILURE!  
15:13 <vmassol> list of failing tests: https://gist.github.com/3033187  
15:13 <vmassol> hmm BlogPostTest isn't failing anymore apparently for me  
15:14 <vmassol> testPreserveUnsavedRichContentAgainstRefresh  testUndoRepeatedPaste testDotAtEndDoesNotDelete seems to be new failing ones though  
15:15 <vmassol> testEnablePlugin too  
15:15 <vmassol> ImportTest was working before too AFAIR  
15:27 <cjd> has quit  
15:33 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
15:47 <cjd> has quit  
15:48 <vmassol> I wonder if these errors in the logs are normal for the webdav tests (haven't checked source code yet): http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-webdav/1588/console  
15:48 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
16:01 <cjd> has quit  
16:07 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
16:09 <CIA-114> tmortagne master \* r537a62c https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/537a62c6a9fd8f92a0e3fbbb6bb6596ffdfbaaea / (12 files in 10 dirs): XE-1208: Add UI test for extension import in XR - http://git.io/l9nPyg  
16:16 <vmassol> hmm the REST tests are failing locally  
16:20 <CIA-114> tmortagne master \* rc168e50 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/c168e5069e3540fc287c671179867fcb586dbd71 / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-extension/xwiki-commons-extension-api/src/test/java/org/xwiki/extension/test/RepositoryUtil.java : [test] Make RepositoryUtil partilally usable without components (initialize and copy repositories and extensions) - http://git.io/ipcX7w  
16:23 <vmassol> actually the problem was that some other tests didn't stop xwiki properly….  
16:24 <vmassol> our functional test startup/stop is pretty unstable  
16:24 <vmassol> I got failures to start xwiki for 120 seconds several times and when trying again it worked  
16:24 <vmassol> and got some strange error while stopping xwiki in https://gist.github.com/3033187  
16:26 <vmassol> still 1 rest failure  
16:26 <+sburjan> vmassol: I remember seeing java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused  
16:26 <+sburjan> at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketConnect(Native Method) too  
16:32 <mookins> has quit  
16:35 <CIA-114> tmortagne master \* rd945d11 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/d945d1136e4b164ee46c0b559a95b23eb1ccf545 / xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/ui/RepositoryTestUtils.java : XE-1196: Add repository test helpers - http://git.io/Ssu3Yg  
16:38 <DSpair\_AFK> is now known as <D-Spair>  
16:39 <D-Spair> Can anyone here tell me how to "style" a verbatim block? I want it to stand out more than it does in the Ruby theme...  
16:40 <vmassol> D-Spair: you can use some CSS Skin Extension  
16:41 <D-Spair> vmassol, Where can I find docs on that?  
16:41 <vmassol> !search skin extension  
16:41 <vmassol> ok bot id sleeping  
16:41 <vmassol> :)  
16:41 <tmortagne> has quit  
16:41 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SkinExtensionsTutorial  
16:41 <vmassol> s/id/is/  
16:42 <D-Spair> Thanks!  
16:42 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
17:02 <D-Spair> vmassol, That looks to require adding a velocity tag to each page I want to apply it to.. Isn't there a way to set it throughout my XWiki application?  
17:02 <vmassol> just use "always" as the scope  
17:02 <vmassol> (rather than "manual")  
17:05 <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: hi. Thanks for improving the rendering engine. Just make sure that you don't penalize performance with your tunings. IMO it's very important to keep the same performance and I'd be more willing to add limitations for some edge cases rather than reduce speed. Unfortunately we don't have any perf test for the rendering....  
17:06 <nIMBVS> has joined #xwiki  
17:06 <vmassol> (note: I'm not saying you decreased perfs, I don't know anything about this :) it's just an idea that sprang to my mind and something we need to be careful about when changing the parsers)  
17:06 <sburjan> has quit  
17:09 <CIA-114> tmortagne master \* rc1b46bc https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/c1b46bcee20ec75507219d6c4da82e1e9d0eb4e2 / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7997: Allow modifying list properties in xwiki.properties in integration tests - http://git.io/KEiq0A  
17:11 <nIMBVS> has quit  
17:16 <D-Spair> vmassol, OK, XWiki is rendering my verbatim blocks using the 'tt' tag, and that does not allow it to be shown as a box... Is there a way to modify that behavior to say perhaps use a "div" with a certain class applied?  
17:17 <+tmortagne> D-Spair: you can use code macro if you want a verbatim in a box  
17:17 <+tmortagne> if you don't want syntax highlight you can use language=none  
17:17 <D-Spair> tmortagne, The code macro does not appear to be working on my install...  
17:18 <+tmortagne> what is not working ?  
17:18 <vmassol> D-Spair: you cannot have a div in inline content  
17:19 <+tmortagne> if you get a jython related error you won't have the issue with language=none since jython is used only when you need to highlight  
17:19 <D-Spair> tmortagne, When I use the "{code}content{/code}" macro, it just shows the tags in plain text on the page.  
17:19 <+tmortagne> {code} does not exists  
17:19 <+tmortagne> it's {{code}}  
17:19 <+tmortagne> like all macros  
17:19 <D-Spair> Aha!  
17:20 <D-Spair> The syntax help shows it with a single set of curly braces.  
17:20 <+tmortagne> I doubt that, you were probably looking at xwiki/1.0 syntax help  
17:20 <vmassol> although I don't think you should use the code macro  
17:20 <D-Spair> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Code+Macro+%28Radeox%29  
17:20 <+tmortagne> that's not the right code macro  
17:20 <+tmortagne> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Code+Macro  
17:20 <+tmortagne> here is the right one  
17:20 <vmassol> unless you want to represent code  
17:21 <D-Spair> vmassol, I do want to represent code...  
17:21 <vmassol> cool then :)  
17:21 <vmassol> then it's much better than use the verbatim syntax  
17:21 <+tmortagne> when you see a reference to radeox it's for xwiki/1.0 syntax  
17:21 <vmassol> s/use/using/  
17:22 <+tmortagne> D-Spair: then don't use language=none :)  
17:23 <D-Spair> tmortagne, I doubt there is a language setting for "puppet manifest"  
17:23 <+tmortagne> don't be so sure, the list of supported language is quite impressive  
17:23 <+tmortagne> see http://pygments.org/languages/  
17:23 <+tmortagne> not even sure http://pygments.org/languages/ is up to date  
17:24 <D-Spair> No mention of puppet on there.  
17:24 <vmassol> D-Spair: nice, I'm starting to learn puppet ;)  
17:25 <D-Spair> vmassol, Make sure you integrate mcollective, that makes it 1000% better!!!  
17:25 <vmassol> ok I'l research that, thanks  
17:26 <D-Spair> vmassol, Being able to run "mco facts kernelversion" and get a list of all kernels I am running in the field is AWESOME!  
17:26 <vmassol> mflorea: wow 32 minutes for the wysiwyg tests alone....  
17:27 <vmassol> :)  
17:27 <+mflorea> all passing?  
17:27 <vmassol> almost  
17:27 <vmassol> Tests run: 283, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 0  
17:27 <vmassol> btw I've found our functional test to be very fragile  
17:28 <vmassol> I don't think a single suite has fully passed  
17:28 <+mflorea> ok, so -30s at most  
17:28 <vmassol> extension manager tests: Tests run: 13, Failures: 3, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0  
17:28 <+mflorea> I fixed the extension manager tests  
17:28 <vmassol> and similar for all test suites, rest, ui, etc  
17:28 <vmassol> haven't had time to dig more  
17:28 <+tmortagne> D-Spair: then you can try and see if it find some syntax highlight that fits  
17:28 <vmassol> so the TPC I'm going to generate is with about 100 failing tests  
17:28 <vmassol> (overall)  
17:29 <vmassol> 72 in escape tests AFAIR  
17:29 <D-Spair> tmortagne, I'm not really worried about syntax highlighting... I just want it to stand out well...  
17:30 <+tmortagne> vmassol: there is lot of stuff failing on jenkins actually so it's probably not only you  
17:30 <+tmortagne> we maybe have a real issue  
17:30 <vmassol> tmortagne: yep, even though I haven't pulled the latest changes which seem to make the ci break  
17:33 <+AndreasJonsson> vmassol: I don't think the performance difference will be noticeable by just making a few changes in the lexical patterns.  
17:33 <D-Spair> Dang  
17:33 <D-Spair> The code macro ALSO shows each individual line length instead of just a single box.  
17:33 <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: it depends, when I was playing with the parser, I've had some bad surprises by changing only a few chars so it really depends what you're changing  
17:34 <vmassol> D-Spair:  that's because it's not standalone  
17:34 <vmassol> add some new lines before and after  
17:34 <vmassol> (not spacs)  
17:34 <+tmortagne> D-Spair: that's probably because you are putting it in an inline context  
17:34 <D-Spair> vmassol, But that will cause my ordered list items to restart their numbering!!!  
17:34 <+tmortagne> (in a paragraph)  
17:34 <vmassol> D-Spair: no  
17:34 <vmassol> use (((…)))  
17:34 <+tmortagne> you need to isolate it if you want a "real" box  
17:35 <D-Spair> vmassol, What is "(((...)))"?  
17:35 <vmassol> D-Spair: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/XWikiSyntax#HGroups  
17:35 <+tmortagne> allow to force standalone content in list of tables cell (which are inline by default)  
17:37 <+tmortagne> basically it's wiki syntax for <div>  
17:37 <D-Spair> vmassol, The (((<content>)))), do I wrap that around the entire ordered list?  
17:37 <vmassol> no  
17:37 <D-Spair> With the code blocks inside as well?  
17:38 <D-Spair> vmassol, Then the explanation in the syntax help needs work...  
17:39 <vmassol> yes it could be improved  
17:39 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/3033821  
17:39 <D-Spair> vmassol, I figured it out...  
17:39 <D-Spair> Thank you for the help..  
17:39 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:39 <D-Spair> I really do appreciate it!  
17:46 <D-Spair> Woot! Now I have exactly what I want... Thanks all!  
17:47 <vmassol> cool  
17:53 <vmassol> guys we're getting lots of jenkins emails, we need to put it back on track IMO  
17:59 <vmassol> ok I have a full TPC results (without xwiki-manager tests)  
18:00 <vmassol> so let's play the game: what % do you think we have for the whole commons+rendering+platform+enterprise? :)

19:05 <vmassol> ok just very slow...
